column4: Hi, I've just set up Apache. Now Im trying to get perl to work too.  If I try to run the .cgi file from localhost, the .cgi file shows up as a textfile instead of being executed. I've added AddHandler cgi-script .cgi, but still it wont work. Help?
cleared the cache in your browser?
also, you have it in the right place?  (you might need to do ExecCGI on the directory)
did you catch my last question?
was it if i did restart Apache? yes i did restart
no, did you set "Options +ExecCGI" on the directory where you have the cgi script?
yes I have +ExecCGI in apache2.conf. I just cleared the cache in firefox. Now I get a different errormessage: forbidden - no permission. Ive manually chmod'ed all files to 777, but still same result
you check permissions on the parent directories?
I have set chmod -R 755 to all dirs and files under the root beginning at /var/www/
I don't know then.  You can post your apache2.conf if you want, but someone in #apache may recognize your problem faster
hold down the 4, does your mouse move?
sergeant_: please try to keep support discussion in the channel
